title: UK Airport Car Parks Warn Travellers About Using Social Media While On Holiday
text:
Insurance companies can refuse to pay out when a person has had their home broken into if the policy holiday has used social media warns UK Airport Car Parks
A travel expert has launched a campaign to warn holidaymakers about the dangers of using social media while on holiday. UK Airport Car Parks who help people to save money on parking cars at UK airports said insurance companies could cancel a policy if their customer has used social media while abroad.
For some years now the police have warned people going on holiday not to share those details with strangers or make it obvious their home will be empty for a week or two. But now, with modern technology and the way criminals now use social media networks that advice has now changed.
Chris Fryer from UK Airport Car Parks said: “Criminals are now using social media to watch potential targets. Insurance companies have now become aware of this and can cancel a claim if a policy holder posts about their holiday on Twitter or Facebook.”
People who have had their homes broken into while on holiday could find the whole experience more traumatic if their insurance company sees they have told people on social media they are going on holiday.
To learn more about the advice on using social media before and while on holiday, please visit http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/holidays-social-media/
By not sharing details of a pre-booked holiday and by not sharing pictures while on holiday, it can help prevent the travellers home being broken into.
To learn more about UKairportcarparks.co.uk, and how to save money on parking a car at a UK airport, please visit http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/ or to read the tips on how to have cheaper holidays, please visit http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/tips-on-cheaper-holidays/
